hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Regime Fade on Failed High-Volume Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When the market is in a NEUTRAL regime and experiences a high-volume (top 10% of 30-day range) breakout attempt above a key resistance level (e.g., 20-day high), followed by a failure to sustain the move and a close back within the prior range, a short-term mean reversion to the lower bound of the neutral range will occur within 3-5 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In a neutral regime, high-conviction breakouts require sustained momentum. A failure on high volume suggests exhaustion of buying pressure and trapped longs, creating a vacuum for a pullback. This is a classic 'false breakout' pattern amplified by regime context.
entry_conditions: Price breaks above 20-day high on volume > 90th percentile of last 30 days
Subsequent daily candle closes back below the 20-day high

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price touches the lower Bollinger Band (20,2) of the neutral consolidation range
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes above the high of the failed breakout candle

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such signals lead to a continuation above the breakout level within the 5-day window, indicating the initial failure was merely a shakeout.
